text: A stately mansion.  A perfect lawn.  A BUTLER carries a  birthday cake with sparking sparklers... Past wealthy MEN in crewcuts and thin ties, WOMEN in cat- sunglasses.  Everyone sings (silent) "Happy Birthday"... CHILDREN follow the cake, in dresses and suits, gathering round NICHOLAS VAN ORTON, 7, guest of honor, who wears a  blindfold.  MOTHER comes to remove the blindfold and Nich ogles the cake, laughs.  He reaches for a sparkler. STEP PRINT: Mother intercepts, fussing, fixing his hair.. Nicholas' FATHER sits near, smoking, nodding.  He's inten thin, wearing a party hat.  He notices the camera without mugging for it, bends to snuff his cigarette in an ashtra SPLICE-JUMP TO/STEP PRINT: a Harlequin CLOWN ties balloon animals.  Nicholas assists, distracted by the inattentive children who look into the camera and pull hair and stand their chairs... Men are drinking, storytelling, laughing.  A fraternity.. The women are elsewhere, doing movie-vamp poses for the  camera, blowing cigarette smoke, brightly dressed, eyelid blue and green, lipstick perfect... Servants clear the table.  Father holds a piece of untouc cake.  A man talks to him, but Father stares off, lost in thought.  He's forgotten the party hat on his head... STEP PRINT: Mother puts her arms around Father and makes face the camera.  He leans in, posing dutifully. SPLICE-JUMP TO: a nanny in uniform, ILSA, holds an INFANT (CONRAD) to the camera, places the baby in Nicholas' arms STEP PRINT: Nicholas is gentle, overwhelmed by cradling h tiny brother. SPLICE-JUMP TO: children play tag.  Across the lawn, Fath heads to the house.  He looks back, walks backwards. STEP PRINT: he gives a small wave, continuing away... Kids chase past.  Nicholas and two other kids huddle, arm locked, spinning round and round, till they stumble diffe directions, falling, laughing, dizzy...
Nicholas gets up, wearing a PUPPET on each hand. STEP PRINT: He walks CLOSE and peers in the camera, steps back, happily talking.  We can't hear because it's SILENT
The emotionless face of NICHOLAS VAN ORTON, just today 40 looks upon itself in a mirror.  He brings an electric sha across his chin, shuts it off, wipes his face with a towe

Nicholas crosses.  The bedroom is spacious, devoid of clu A weight-machine in a far corner.  A big T.V.  shows CNN  with no sound. At a bedside table, Nicholas picks up a heavy, gold ROLEX sliding it on, checking the time.  6:32.

Nicholas stands at the kitchen island his tie thrown over his shoulder, eating breakfast.  ILSA, now elderly, is ac the way doing dishes. The only sounds are the tiny clicks of Nicholas' knife an fork against his plate.  He's reading a German newspaper. Nicholas jabs the last piece of egg, skewers the last bit ham and last square of toast.  Plate's clean. He sips his last swallow of juice, dabs his mouth with a  napkin, picks up his briefcase and heads to a back door.
(without looking)
Thank you.
Have a nice day.
Nicholas walks down a garden pathway to a three-car garag He looks at his Rolex.
Bentley Continental Coupe.  Quiet.  Nicholas drives, begi humming, barely audible.  A Prince song, "Erotic City."
(sings, to self)
...until the dawn... making love  till cherry's gone.. (humming, quiet)
... Erotic City, you and me... Nicholas changes lanes, HONKING the HORN, impassive.  We BARELY HEAR the BEEPING in here.  He glances back. He drives, adjusts his mirror.  Resumes humming.
Distinctive SAN FRANCISCO skyline on the horizon. Nicholas' building is a brownstone bookended by skyscrape Old money dwarfed by new.  The Bentley arrives...
The Bentley moves past a valet station.  One VALET follow The Bentley takes its place.  A brass plaque reads: "NICHOLAS VAN ORTON, Van Orton Enterprises."  The valet o the car door for Nicholas.
Two objects on Nicholas' desk: phone and laptop computer. He's on the phone, operating the laptop with one hand. Business talk, mile-a-minute.
(from phone)
... might be perched up on majority  shares, but you're not the only one  who gets hurt if the actuals crash.   Forecasts were fucked to begin with.
(into phone)

The moment Baer/Grant's P and L report  is placed in my hand, I will be speed  dialing your number. Empty walls.  No distractions.  MARIA, the proper executi assistant, stands practically at attention.
Is that a promise?
I'm sorry... I'm unfamiliar with the  term.
What if Alan calls me with a sob  story about substantiation procedure?
Take evasive action: have your  secretary say you're in a meeting.   Goodbye, Jack.
Yeah. Nicholas hangs up, shuffling computer windows: stock quot pie-charts, graphs, lists.  Maria refers to an index card
Invitations: the Museum Gala.
No.
The Fitzwilliam Botanical Garden  Annual Fundraiser.
No.
The Hinchberger wedding.
Let me think... (sits back, eyes closed)
Hordes of men in tuxedos.  Everyone's  droning.  Ludwell's trying to break  the ice by reciting an off-color  limerick...
(impatient)
I'll send your regrets.  Honestly,  why must I even bother?
Because, if you don't know about  society, you don't have the  satisfaction of avoiding it. A KNOCK and a female ASSISTANT enters.  There's a lot mor NOISE and ACTIVITY behind her.
Elizabeth on line three. Nicholas taps his fingers on his lips, considering.
Your ex-wife.
I know who she is. (to assistant)
Take a message.
Um... Happy Birthday, sir. Nicholas squints.
(icily)
Thank you, Maggie. The assistant backs out.  Nicholas returns to his compute
I don't like her.
I wouldn't mention the following,  except he was very insistent.  It's  obviously some sort of prank...
What?
A gentleman left a message requesting  a lunch, but I assured him...
What gentleman, Maria?
A Mister... Seymour Butts. Nicholas looks up.  He sits back, lost in thought.
(to himself)
"Under the Bleachers"... by Seymour  Butts.
Pardon me?  I'm afraid I don't...
Cancel lunch.  Make reservations at  Campton Place for me and Mr. Butts. Maria nods, heading out, high heels clicking as she cross
And, put the reservation in my name.
Upscale.  Quiet.  Nicholas is in a booth facing the rear, studying a thick FINANCIAL STATEMENT, making tiny notatio A WAITRESS arrives.
Ready to order, sir?
I'm still waiting... Nicholas points out the other plate.  The waitress leaves
Excuse me... She returns.  He slides his empty glass toward her.

This was iced tea. He's returned to his report.  The waitress takes the glas and leaves, irritated.  Nicholas checks his watch.  An  EXAGGERATED SNEEZE is HEARD and liquid hits the back of h neck -- AH-CHOO!... Nicholas jumps, sickened, turning to face CONRAD, who hol a spray bottle and smiles.
Hey there, Nickie.
(repulsed)
Conrad, what a surprise.  Gesundheit.
Happy Birthday, man.
(nods)
"Seymour Butts."  I never get tired  of that one.

That's why it's a classic.  Come on,  man... how 'bout a hug... ? Nicholas is wiping his neck with a napkin as Conrad force hug on him.  Conrad takes a seat, good-looking, unkempt,  tan, wearing a too-big suit jacket.
They gave me a free jacket at the  door.
They'll be wanting it back.
Not after I'm done with it. (laughs)
Actually, I've been here.  In grad- school I bought crystal-meth from  the maitre d'.
Which grad-school? Conrad smiles.  The brothers take each other in for a mom Long moment.  They're a bit stunned to be reunited.
You look good.
So do you.  And to think I was  worried...
About me?
How long's it been?  Since mom died...  four years?  How are you?
Never better.
Elizabeth?
Divorced.  Remarried to some  pediatrician or gynecologist, or  pediatric gynecologist, in Sausalito.
Too bad, I liked her.  So, you're  all alone in the House of Pain?
I redecorated.  What about you?
Nowhere in particular.  Don't you  keep track of my whereabouts anymore?
Connie... what brings you here?  Is  everything alright?
Yeah.
You need anything?
No.
Really?

I don't need anything from you.  I  was laying on a beach somewhere in  Spain, naked, and, it hit me --  Nickie's birthday.  So, here I am,  four layovers, twenty-seven hours  flying and one donkey ride later.   Not necessarily in that order. Conrad drops an envelope on the table.
For you.
You shouldn't have. Nicholas opens it, takes out a sappy, Hallmark B-day card A BUSINESS CARD falls out.  Nicholas picks it up...
What do you get for the man who has  just slightly more than everything? The card: "Consumer Recreation Services."  With a PHONE N and ADDRESS below.
Call that number.
"Consumer Recreation Services." What,  do they make golf clubs?
Trust me.  Call that number.
Why?
They make your life fun.  Their only  guarantee is you will not be bored.
Fun?
You've heard of it.  You've seen  other people having it.  They're an  entertainment service, but more than  that.
This isn't an escort service?
It's a profound life experience.
Like a stroke?
Call them.  Trust me.
The waitress shows up with Nicholas' iced tea, spills som Nicholas blots it up with a napkin.
Sorry.  Let me get you another napkin.
I'll be fine... if we could just... She moves off as Nicholas raises a finger to order, ignor
Tell me you'll call.
Okay.
Will you?
I said I would...
But, will you?
Are you still on medication?
(taken aback)
Why would you say that? The waitress arrives.
Ready to order, gentlemen?
(ignores, to Conrad)
I didn't mean it like it sounded...
I'm not on anything anymore.  I'm  not even seeing a shrink.  I'm happy. (notices waitress,  turning to her)
Do you mind... ?! The waitress gives him a look, leaves.
(to Nicholas)
I thought you'd like this.  Best  thing I ever did.  If you don't want  to do it, DON'T...
I'll call them, okay?
It doesn't matter...
I'm going to call.
Do it for YOU.
Okay, okay... okay? (pause, studies card)
I just... you know I hate surprises.

I know... Conrad CLINKS his fork against a glass, motioning... Behind Nicholas, WAITERS, WAITRESSES and BUS-BOYS, lying wait, now come to SING "HAPPY BIRTHDAY." Conrad stands, loving it.  Nicholas forces a fake smile.
The Bentley cruises hilly streets, ESTATES on all sides.
Nicholas is on his CELLULAR PHONE.  CLASSICAL MUSIC PLAYS
(from cellular)
... seen the profitability report.   No one's happy with the numbers.
(into cellular)
Imagine how much MORE unhappy I am.
You'll deal with Alan?
Correct.
Okay, Nicholas.  Sleep well.
I plan to. He increases VOLUME on the CLASSICAL MUSIC, makes a turn. He looks out his window, watching the street roll past...
SILENT, HOME MOVIE-ISH IMAGES as before: YOUNG NICHOLAS, peers out from a LIMOUSINE, watching his neighborhood pas PERIOD FASHIONS, PERIOD CARS and HOUSES...

head_text.subj: BACK TO SCENE, IN THE BENTLEY

text: Nicholas faces front.  The Bentley comes to the formidabl FRONT GATE of the mansion.  The gate begins to slide open Nicholas stares ahead, expressionless.

The LIMOUSINE pulls up the ungated driveway.  Young Nicho emerges, carrying books, waving goodbye to the CHAUFFEUR. Young Nicholas runs past rose bushes, heading to the hous but slows, looking up... High up, Nicholas' FATHER, in a robe, stands on a balcony railing, looking to the sky.  He's weary, lowers his gaze Young Nicholas is puzzled, gives a tentative wave. Father just stares, eyes dead, expression blank.

head_text.subj: BACK TO SCENE, IN THE BENTLEY

text: Nicholas looks down, puts the car in gear and drives... THRU THE WINDSHIELD: the Bentley's headlights sweep the  stately Van Orton house.
Nicholas exits the garage, walks up the garden path.  Ahe Ilsa's leaving through the kitchen door of the house, hea across the yard to the GUEST HOUSE.
Dinner's in the oven.
Thank you.  Goodnight. At the rear door, Nicholas stops himself.
Oh, I saw Conrad today. Ilsa stops, looking back.  They're far from each other.
You did?  How is he?
Okay.  I think he's into some sort  of new personal improvement cult.
(nods, at a loss)
Well... send my love, if you see him  again. Nicholas nods.  Ilsa leaves.

Nicholas uses mitts to remove a dinner plate from the ove sets it on a waiting tray: huge cheeseburger and hand-cut french fries, perfectly presented. Nicholas picks up a CUPCAKE with a B-day candle in it.

Nose-bleed-high ceilings.  Cavernous fireplace.  THREE TV in the ENTERTAINMENT WALL, the largest showing CNN. Nicholas is seated in a chair facing his meal, pouring a  glass of champagne. He toasts to no one, takes a sip.  The PHONE RINGS.
Nicholas looks to it, hesitates.  He hits SPEAKERPHONE.
(to speakerphone)
Elizabeth.
(from speakerphone)
Happy Birthday, Nick.
(looks at watch)
Eleven forty.  You almost didn't  make it this year. Nicholas uses a REMOTE to MUTE BERNARD SHAW on the TV.
Did you have a great birthday?
Does Rose Kennedy have a black dress?   You know my parties.  I went not  once, but twice through the spanking- machine.
I can only imagine.  How are you?
Connie asked me the same thing today.
Connie, really?  I always liked him.
Anyway...
I just thought this... might be  difficult for you.
Just another birthday.
I meant because of your father.
That's right.  He was forty, wasn't  he?  Hadn't thought about it, to  tell you the truth, thanks for the  reminder.
Why do I call you... ?
I honestly don't know.  Listen, give  my best to Doctor Mel and Rachel....
She has a little brother on the way.   We just did the ultrasound.
No kidding?  An official nuclear  family.  You must be pleased.
We are.  We couldn't be happier. Nicholas smiles thinly, bored, waiting for more.
Well, so... thanks for calling.   I've got some work here...
I should let you go.
Take care of yourself.
You too, Nicholas.  I mean that, I  really do.

Um-hm.  Good luck.  Bye. He PUSHES OFF the PHONE in the middle of her "goodbye." uses the t.v. remote to give BERNARD SHAW back his VOICE. Nicholas eats, watching the news.  He takes out the busin card Conrad gave him, looks at it, puts it on the table. The card: "Consumer Recreation Services." Nicholas sits back, chewing.  He stares at the ceiling.
SILENT IMAGES: Nicholas' FATHER stands on the high balcon as before.  He looks skyward one last time, then LAUNCHES INTO SPACE... falling in EXTREME SLOW MOTION...
A head-first dive...
"DING," elevator doors open.  Nicholas and TWO EXECUTIVES are talking.  As PEOPLE get on, the two executives get of
We're getting off here. Nicholas follows.  He and the executives huddle nearby.
(voice low)
So, we understand each other?
We do.
Make it work on paper, and you can  count on my full support.

Right-o.  We'll talk.  Soon. They shake.  The executives walk away.  Nicholas returns elevator, pushes the button, waiting.  He turns, noticing A massive WALL OF TRANSLUCENT GLASS marks the office of  "C.R.S."  Modern.  Activity beyond it. Nicholas finds this disconcerting.  He takes out his wall digging up the C.R.S. business card, studying it... looki again to the glass facade to double check. He looks at his Rolex.

head_text.subj: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE GLASS DOORS

text: Nicholas enters.  A female RECEPTIONIST speaks into a  HEADSET/PHONE.  EMPLOYEES mill about.  UTILITY MEN sort  crawlspace wiring.
(to receptionist,  shows "C.R.S." card)
Is this Consumer Recreation  Services... ? The Receptionist takes the card.  In the b.g., JIM FEINGO pays a DELIVERY GUY for CHINESE FOOD.
(into PHONE)
You shouldn't feel this reflects  negatively upon yourself. (to Nicholas)
Just a moment. (back into phone)

We hope we haven't caused you any  inconvenience.  Thank you for  considering C.R.S. She studies the card, hangs up and motions to Feingold, a bald, amiable engineer-type who passes with his food bag.
Mister Feingold... could you assist  this gentleman? Feingold spins on his heels, looking, walking over with h hand out.  Nicholas shakes.
Jim Feingold, V.P., E.D.A.   Engineering and Data Analysis.
I'm not quite sure how this works.   My brother...
Oh, here we go... Feingold takes the card the receptionist offers, examines it, turns it over: finds FOUR NUMBERS on the back.
(of the numbers)
Excellent.  Let's get started. Nicholas picks up his briefcase to follow Feingold.
Big operation.  Feingold leads past partitioned cubicles  that seem to go on forever.  C.R.S. WORKERS abound. TELEPHONE CO. WORKMEN operate on the phones.
Sorry about  about all the hullabaloo.   We're still moving.  Stick with me...  I've got an office around here  somewhere.
Feingold reaches open BOXES, begins collecting pages from each, loading up on all sorts of forms.  he holds out his leaking, greasy food bag to Nicholas.
Mind holding this... ? Nicholas reluctantly takes it, keeping it at arms length.
Feingold types at his computer.  Nicholas stands, looking through the pile of forms on a clipboard.
(TYPES in keyboard)
(studies screen)
A gift from Conrad Van Orton.   Interesting...
What is? Feingold picks up his Chinese food, eats using chop-stick The BOX features a grinning CARTOON PANDA mascot,
(still studying screen)
Your brother was a client with our  London branch.  We do a sort of  informal scoring.  His numbers were  outstanding. (holds up box)
Sure you're not hungry at all...? Tung Hoy, best in Chinatown...
No, thank you.
(eating, mouth full)

You need to fill out those forms.   Application, psych-tests: M.M.P.I.   and T.A.T.  For the financial  questionnaire, don't answer anything  you don't feel like.  We'll run a  T.R.W.... Nicholas looks through the densely written forms.
(reading FORM)
"I sometimes hurt small animals.   True or False?"  "I feel guilty when  I masturbate..." Nicholas looks up, skeptical.  Feingold shrugs, embarrass
I don't write the questions.  I just  review them.
What's all this for?
We want a sense of your overall  capabilities, limitations, turn-ons,  turn-offs...
No, I mean, what is it FOR?  What  are you selling?
Oh... it's a game.
A game?
Tailored specifically to each  participant.  Think of it as a great  vacation, except you don't go to it,  it comes to you.
What kind of vacation?
It's different every time.
(patience waning)
Humor me with specifics.
We provide whatever's lacking.
And if nothing's lacking?
May I make two suggestions...?
Do you really expect me to participate  without knowing a single thing?

First, admit to yourself that it  sounds intriguing.  Second, you don't  have to decide today.  Take the silly  tests, fill out the forms.  One day,  the game begins.  You either love it  or hate it.  Decide then.  We're  like an experimental Book-of-the- Month-Club; drop out at any time  with no further obligation. (smiles)
That was my sales pitch. Nicholas thumbs thru the forms one last time...
How long will these take?
An hour for those... maybe another  for the physical.
Physical?

Cursory examination.  Turn-your-head- and-cough sort of thing.  You'll be  out of here in no time. Feingold takes out a ballpoint pen, clicks it and offers to Nicholas.  Nicholas takes it. On the pen, in tiny letters: the C.R.S. LOGO.

Nicholas fills out an APPLICATION of endless questions. #2 pencil fills in circles on a long M.M.P.I. form. CLOSE ON: "I often feel someone is following me.  True/Fa "I hate vegetables.  True/False."  "Vegetables hate me.   True/False." WHITE ROOM.  A stone-faced PSYCHOLOGIST holds up CARDS.

Nicholas gives his unenthusiastic interpretation into a T RECORDER, checks his Rolex. One CARD shows a large ant in an apron feeding a TV dinne to a human child.  That card is replaced by another of a slipping head over heels on a banana peel. - Nicholas wears HEADPHONES, facing a TECHNICIAN, raising finger on his left fist or right fist for each low BEEP. Nicholas sighs, can't believe he's doing this.
Electronic MONITORS and PRINTERS record Nicholas' EEG and EKG.  He's on an exam table, wearing a paper gown, covere in SENSORS and WIRES, talking on a C.R.S. telephone.
(into phone)
... cancel.  Push Cooper back to  Wednesday afternoon. A TECHNICIAN studies readouts.  A NURSE takes BLOOD PRESS
(from phone)
Mister Sutherland called about  Baer/Grant Publishing.
(into phone)
Tomorrow.  Hold on... (to NURSE)
How much longer?
Almost done.

I heard that two hours ago. The nurse smiles, pumping up the blood-pressure cuff. Nicholas returns to the phone. - DARK ROOM.  Images FLASH on a screen: SHAPES, CURSE WOR PICTURES of U.S. PRESIDENTS, INSECTS... In flickering light, Nicholas, still in his gown, watches with THREE BUTTONS before him, pushing one from time to t Frustrated, he looks around.  He stands and turns...
Directly into the projector's bright BEAM OF LIGHT.
Hello... ?  Anyone there? (squints, holds up  hand)
Hello?!
Nicholas dresses, alone, pulling up his pants.  He notice above: a MIRRORED DOME in the corner, obviously a camera. Nicholas pulls on his jacket as Feingold arrives.
Sorry to keep you waiting.
Don't worry.  It's been terrific  spending the entire day with your  "crack team".
It's all down to this... Feingold holds out a CLIPBOARD with PAPERWORK in it. Nicholas takes it, studies it, wary.

An insurance company requirement.   It states that you are aware "the  game" exists and that you are a  willing participant in said game, so  on and so forth. Nicholas flips a page and Feingold leans over, pointing.
(of the paperwork)
One guarantee.  Payment's entirely  at your brother's discretion and, as  a gift, dependent on your  satisfaction.
(still reading)
You mean, I don't like it, he doesn't  pay?
It's never happened.  We've never  had an unsatisfied customer.
You mean, dissatisfied.
(glances at form)
That's right -- you're a left-brain  word fetishist. Nicholas uses the C.R.S. pen to sign.  Feingold turns pag
Initials... initials, and... (another page)
Sign here. Nicholas is about to sign when Feingold grabs his wrist..
In blood. (laughs)
Just kidding. Nicholas signs.  Feingold tears out a few PINK TINTED COP and hands them to Nicholas, kind of in a hurry now.
Your copies, thank you.  Keep the  pen.  We'll let you know. Feingold exits, gives a thumbs-up and a WINK, shuts the d Nicholas is a bit bewildered.  He continues dressing.
(muttering to self)
... grown man just winked at me.
WHAM! -- a blue racquetball BALL SLAMS a wall... THRU A WINDOW: Nicholas plays, alone, swatting violently the ball.  We HEAR a PHONE CONVERSATION in VOICE OVER:
What about Monday or Tuesday?
Bad for me.
How 'bout tonight?
Unfortunately I'm working all evening.   Wednesday's the only possibility  right now...
Okay.
Dinner?
Fine.  I get to pick the restaurant.
By the way, I went to C.R.S...
Really?  What'd you think?
They seemed disorganized. Nicholas finishes playing, exits.  The ball keeps bouncin
Well, the office is new.  When I did  it in London, they'd been around  awhile.  You gonna do this?
Haven't decided yet.
Carpeted floors and mahogany lockers.  Nicholas sits at h locker, wet, in a monogrammed robe, toweling his hair. VOICES can be HEARD O.S.: BUSINESSMAN 1 and BUSINESSMAN 2
... getting in on the ground floor  of the next Disneyland.
C.R.S. will not go public.  They're  family owned.
Stranger things have happened.
No, they haven't, actually. Nicholas leans to look around a locker.  Businessman 1 an dress, two fat-cats.  Nicholas leans back, still listenin
They just opened here.
The game in San Francisco?  You see,  they're doing fine without any of  us.
Nicholas enters, looking around, spotting Businessman 1 a 2 across the room.  He gets the BARTENDER'S attention,  motioning to the businessmen.
New members?
I believe so, sir.
This round's on me. Nicholas moves casually toward the men...
LATER.  Another round arrives at the table where Nicholas and Businessman 1 and 2 chat.  The businessmen smoke ciga
... last time I played Pebble, I  swore I'd never pick up a club again.
Speaking of games... I couldn't help  but overhear you talking about C.R.S. Businessman 1 and 2 share a furtive glance.  Nicholas  discretely waves cigar smoke out of his face.
I only mention it because I took the  test this afternoon, down on  Montgomery Street.
Did you?  Kudos.
So, yours hasn't started?
Not yet.  I was hoping you could  tell me... uh... (almost embarrassed)
What is it? Businessman 1 and 2 smile.  Shared enlightenment.
(to Businessman 2,  knowingly)
Ahh, what is it?
The eternal question.
(to Nicholas)
I envy you.  I wish I could go back  and do it for the first time all  over again... He raises his glass.  They toast.
Here's to... new experiences. (gulps drink)
If you'll excuse me, I've got to be  going.  'Night, Jon... Nicholas. He leaves.  Nicholas focuses on Businessman 2.
Did you play recently?
Hm?  No, about a year ago.  I was  working out of Los Angeles.
(nodding)
I've heard good things about their  London branch. (leans in)
You have to admit, it sounds like  some fantasy, role-playing nonsense.
You want to know what it is?  What  it's all about? (off Nicholas' nod)
John.  Chapter nine.  Verse twenty- five.
I, uh... haven't been to Sunday school  in years...
"Whereas once I was blind, now I can  see." (rises)
Night, Nick.  Best of luck. Businessman 2 puffs his cigar, walks away.  Nicholas watc him go, then pauses, puzzled, mouthing the words to himse

A table of unhappy LAWYERS.  Nicholas goes thru a thick  CONTRACT with a red pen, CIRCLING, CROSSING-OUT and SCRAW QUESTION MARKS ON paragraphs that displease him. SUTHERLAND, trust personified, in his late 50's, stands b Nicholas, imperturbable.
(still scrawling)
As far as I'm concerned... (reading, x-ing out)
... if the Baer/Grant meeting does  not take place tomorrow, it might as  well never take place at all. Nicholas slides the contract to the center of the table.

When Mr. Van Orton boards his plane  in the morrow, he will have every  contract, side agreement and addendum,  the complete closing package,  flawlessly revised. INSTANT UPROAR as the contract is grabbed up.  All the la talk at once, fearful, arguing, protesting.
Ladies and gentlemen...
(as they quiet)

This is why you're paid twice what  you deserve.  So you will miss another  opera you would've fallen asleep  during anyway... During this, Nicholas' CELLULAR PHONE is HEARD RINGING. Nicholas takes it out, irritated.

The meeting has been moved forward.   It affords you the opportunity to  show our client how well you will  rise to his exhilarating challenge. QUIET COMMOTION resumes as Nicholas takes his cellular ph to a corner, answering impatiently:
(into cellular)
Yes?
(from cellular)
Nicholas van Orton?
Yes, who is this?
This is Cynthia calling from C.R.S...
How did you get this number?
We've finished processing your  application...
I'm in a meeting...
... I'm afraid your application was  rejected.
(pause)
Pardon me?
You shouldn't feel this reflects  negatively upon yourself.  We hope  we haven't caused you any  inconvenience...
This is absurd...
Thank you for thinking of C.R.S. CLICK -- she's hung up.  Nicholas folds the phone and poc it, his mind suddenly far away from the meeting behind hi Sutherland steps close, concerned, quiet...
Anything wrong... ?
Nothing.  Nothing at all.
Nicholas guides the Bentley down streets lined with  skyscrapers, staring ahead.  A previous PHONE CONVERSATIO is HEARD in V.O., a PHONE RINGING... RINGING... RINGING..
Would you like voice-mail?
I suppose.
I'll connect you.  Thank you for  calling the Four Seasons.
The Bentley heads towards home.  The V.O. PHONE CONVERSAT CONTINUES uninterrupted, CLICKING, then...

(to herself)
This is getting out of hand. As she starts up.

ABANDONED BUILDING.  Boarded-over windows are kicked open from inside.  Nicholas and Christine look out. They climb out onto ANOTHER FIRE ESCAPE, two stories up a a trash filled, dumpster crowded alley.
Never did catch your name.
Nicholas.  Nicholas Van Orton.

Nicholas Van Orton?  What are you, a  czar? Nicholas moves to the catch of the fire escape ladder, un it.  The LADDER DROPS to bridge the gap to the ground, KE GOING, sliding free and disconnecting -- falls flat to th ground below with a LOUD, ECHOING CLATTER.
(pause)
That's classic.
(staring down, misery)
Why... ? Christine crosses to the far edge of the railing, points.
We hang down here and drop.  The  garbage'll break our fall.
I think not. Christine climbs over the fire escape railing...
Afraid you're going to ruin your one- legged suit? She lowers herself down, hanging off, legs dangling...

Be careful... A metal DOOR is THROWN OPEN below.  TWO THAI BUS-BOYS com out, dumping garbage, smoking cigarettes, laughing. Above, Christine looks up at Nicholas, mortified.  She no urgently for him to help her back up.  Nicholas climbs th rail, beside her, trying to get a grip, none too effectiv Below, one bus-boy looks up, shouting.  The other bus-boy looks.  They back away, SPEAKING RAPID THAI, pointing.
What are they... ? (realizing)
Hey! Christine lets go with one hand, trying to pull her skirt shut.  Nicholas loses hold, drops her... Christine lands hard in garbage.
Are you okay... ?! Nicholas drops, alarmed... lands in broken plastic bags o wet garbage, slipping as he moves to Christine.  Bus-boys are helping her up.

I'm okay... I'm okay, thank you... Bus-boys keep questioning in Thai.  Nicholas and Christin brush off.  Nicholas takes off his spewed jacket, shakes in disgust, straightens his tie.  They stop... At the doorway, all the COOKS, BUS-BOYS, WAITERS and DISH WASHERS stare at Nicholas and Christine in wonder.
Nicholas and Christine stare back.  Nicholas looks to  Christine, brushing rotten lettuce off her shoulder, nods the restaurant workers, clears his throat.
Table for two, please. He offers his arm to Christine, she takes it, they head i
ONE CONTINUOUS LONG SHOT:  Nicholas and Christine walk, t their time, eating out of take-out boxes.
Where are we going?
(points at skyline)
That tall, bright building.  Near  there. They walk a long time in silence.  A POLICE CAR moves fro behind.  POLICEMAN shines a flashlight up and down Nichol
Everything okay, miss?
Yeah.  How are you? The police car keeps pace, then drives on.
Nicholas enters, turning on lights, which dim to a warm g Christine takes in the impressive office.  Nicholas cross to a wall, opens a hidden closet, chooses a shirt.
There's a shower, if you'd like. Christine leans to peek in the bathroom.
A shower in your office?  You an  athlete or something? Nicholas puts on a new shirt.
Christine circles the desk, runs her fingers down his pho
What exactly do you do?
Investment banking.  Moving money  from place to place. Christine has wandered to the closed blinds, opening them reveal a breathtaking view of the city.
Nice.
Hm? (looks)
Oh, yes. Nicholas takes out a SWEATSHIRT and offers it.
A fresh shirt...
(takes shirt, crossing)
If this was my office, I wouldn't  keep that closed.
I don't spend much time looking out  the window. (goes to desk)
I'll call you a taxi. Christine faces away, throws off her filthy shirt... Nicholas, on the phone, looks to Christine's shapely back and RED BRA.  He averts his eyes, embarrassed...
Oh!  Uh... Christine puts on the PENN STATE sweatshirt, straightens
Thanks. Nicholas nods, phone to his ear.
TWO CABS.  Nicholas opens the door of the first for Chris She faces him, close.
I know the owner of Campton Place.   I could talk to him in the morning.
Don't.  It was a shitty job anyway.   I overreacted. Christine sits, keeps her legs out the door of the cab. Nicholas stands waiting for her to pull her legs in.
Goodnight.
I don't think I've ever spent this  much time with someone who didn't  even ask my name.
The maitre d' called you Christine.
(remembering)
Right.  Call me Christy.
Goodnight, Christy.  It was nice  meeting you.
Give me an address so I can send  your shirt back.
Keep it. She looks up at Nicholas, sits inside.  He shuts the door and steps back.  Christine rolls her window down.
I have a confession to make.  Someone  gave me six-hundred dollars to spill  drinks on you, as a practical joke.
Seriously?  What did they say?

They said five hundred.  I said six.   They said the man in the gray flannel  suit.  I think I said, you mean the  attractive guy in the gray flannel  suit? Christine smiles, rolls up the window.  The taxi leaves. Nicholas watches it go.  A twinge of regret.
Nicholas' cab pulls up at the closed restaurant, behind t Bentley.  A restaurant VALET sweeps the sidewalk, waves t greet as Nicholas gets out of the cab.

Nicholas comes from the bathroom, just showered.  He look at CNN on TV.  He walks to change channels: infomercials, B+W movies, cartoons.  BUGS BUNNY.  Nicholas leaves Bugs  Bunny on, steps back, watching. He sits on the bed.
Nicholas sleeps.  Cordless PHONE RINGING.  He stirs, awak face creased, hair mussed.
(in phone, voice cracks)
Hel... hello?
(from phone)
Mr. Van Orton, it's Maria.  I... I  wasn't sure I should call...
(in phone)
What time is it? Nicholas studies his CLOCK RADIO: 11:05.  He picks it up examines it, suspicious.
(from phone)
Eleven o'clock.  I took the liberty  of rescheduling your nine a.m. with  Allison and Dietrich.  Are you...  not not feeling well?
I'll be in in an hour.  I left my  briefcase at fifteen-thirty-three  Montgomery.  Check with their lost  and found.
Alan Baer's in town, at the Ritz- Carlton.
Really?
He's requesting dinner tonight.
We'll let him know.

Also, the Claremont Hotel called to  say they have your American Express  card at the front desk.  You left it  last night? Nicholas is confused.  He crosses with the phone, finds a studies his wallet.  He fingers an empty plastic pocket.
Should I send someone... ?
No.  Give me their number.
Eight, four, three, three-thousand.
See  you in awhile.  Goodbye. Nicholas hangs up, dials.
(from phone)
Claremont Resort and Spa.
(into phone)
This is Nicholas Van Orton.  I'm  told my American Express card...
(from phone)
Yes, Mister Van Orton.  Everything's  in order.  The concierge has arranged  for the wine and flowers in the room.
Has he?
And, a young woman phoned just now  to say she's on route but running a  little late.
(pause)
Did this young woman leave her name?
I'm sure I don't know.
Thank you. Nichola hangs up, interest piqued.
Nicholas drives the Bentley.  PREVIOUS CONVERSATION:
There's no answer.  Would you like  his voice mail?
Tell him his brother called, and to  call back soon as he can.
Yes, sir. CELLULAR DISCONNECT.  Nicholas looks in his rearview mirr THRU MIRROR: a grimy BLACK SEDAN follows... keeps distanc
Grand hotel.  Nicholas leaves his car with the valet.
At the GLASS DOORS, Nicholas pushes thru.  A THIN MAN in plain suit isn't looking, BUMPS Nicholas.
Sorry.  My fault. Thin Man exits.  Nicholas crosses the opulent lobby to th desk.  The grinning HOTEL MANAGER spots him coming.
Ah, Mr. Van Orton.  Here you go...
Have we met? He hands over Nicholas' AMEX CARD, which Nicholas studies
I believe so.  If you would just  sign here... The manager offers a CHARGE SLIP and pen.  Nicholas looks the manager, the slip, then signs.  The manager hits a BE A BELLHOP arrives.
Show Mr. Van Orton to his room.
The key?
Hm?
Is there a room key?
Didn't I give you two?
No, you didn't... Nicholas shakes his head and pats his pockets, stops, fee one pocket... reaches in and takes out a GOLD KEY on a ho key chain.  Nicholas looks to the GLASS DOORS.
Cute.
Long hallway.  Nicholas follows the Bellhop.  They arrive the door to ROOM 277.
I'll take it from here. He tips the Bellhop, who leaves, uses the key, entering..
Nicholas shuts the door.  There's a room-service cart wit wine chilling.  Nicholas moves down this short hall...

Hello... ? His jaw drops.  The room is TRASHED.  Curtains shredded,  furniture overturned, television imploded, mirror spiderw smashed, walls full of holes. Nicholas moves forward, having spotted... His battered BRIEFCASE on the ruined mattress. The latch is undone.  Nicholas opens it. Inside: MANY PHOTOGRAPHS of blurry SEX acts.  Bodies in  motion.  Limbs.  Breasts.  A NAKED WOMAN tied to the bed. One PHOTO shows two women entwined with a NAKED MAN who a to be NICHOLAS.  It's a so-so cut-and-paste job. A LOUD KNOCKING at the door startles Nicholas.  He closes the briefcase, freaked. He hurries to the door as POUNDING is HEARD again, puts h eye to the peephole. THRU THE PEEPHOLE: a MAID gets out her keys.
(thru door)
Time to make up the room. Nicholas fumbles with the SECURITY CHAIN, slides it in pl as the door opens -- stopped.  Nicholas keeps hidden.
Could you come back later?

Yes, sir.  Sorry. THRU THE PEEPHOLE: the maid moves away. Nicholas crosses to retrieve his briefcase, and is crossi back when he stops in his tracks upon seeing... On a dresser, a MIRROR covered in COCAINE lines and resid

Nicholas turns on the faucet, washing the cocaine down th sink, hands shaking.  The mirror edge cuts his thumb and gives a cry, drops the mirror, which SHATTERS on the floo Nicholas sucks his thumb, puts it under the faucet.  He f a hand cloth and wraps it round his thumb. There are big blood droplets on the sink and floor. Nicholas grabs wads of tissues from a box on the back of toilet, using them to blot up the blood, throwing tissues the toilet and flushing. Nicholas keeps wiping blood.  The toilet burps, OVERFLOWI WATER SPILLS OUT... Nicholas backs away, panicked, exiting...
Nicholas looks out from Room 277.  He sees a MAID CART, H an O.S. VACUUM CLEANER.  He run-walks down the hall, hugg his briefcase.  He pushes thru a STAIRWELL DOOR.
Nicholas takes his Bentley back from the valet, pulling o fast to the street.  Further back, the grimy BLACK SEDAN  moves from the curb.
Nicholas' mind races.  He wipes sweat off his face. He glances in his rearview... THRU MIRROR: the black sedan, following again. Resolve comes to Nicholas, and anger.  He speeds up.
The Bentley weaves thru traffic, taking a corner sharp. Nicholas spins the wheel, heading...

Nicholas brakes hard, gets out of the Bentley and heads f the mouth of the alley... As the black sedan follows, blocked, stopping.  Nicholas  comes to pull open the car door, confronting the rumpled, PLUMP GUY behind the wheel.
What the fuck... ?!
Why are you following me?
I don't know what you're talking  about.  I'm just driving... He falters as he follows Nicholas' angry gaze to the seat beside him where a FILE is open to a PHOTO of NICHOLAS.
(fumbling to close  file)
Look... what I'm doing is none of  your business...
Is Alan Baer "the Game?"  Is that  what this is?
(defiant pause)
Friend... why don't you back off. He leans as he talks... inside his jacket, he wears a gun Nicholas reaches across and pulls the gun, hefting it.
Hey... !
(of the gun)
Nice touch.  Does the game use real  bullets... ?

Nicholas points the gun at the sedan's rear tire, FIRES! The gun is SHOCKINGLY LOUS -- BURSTS the TIRE! Nicholas looks to the smoking weapon, blanching. Plump Guy leaps to the other seat, scrambling out the  passenger door, submissive...
Okay, I'm a private investigator.   Somebody hired me to keep tabs on  you... Nicholas lifts the gun, unsure, pointing it awkwardly...

Who... who hired you? Plump Guy bolts, running away down the alleyway.  Nichola aims the gun after him, but catches himself, lowers it. runs the other direction, back to the Bentley... Nicholas gets in the car, drops the gun on the seat, driv
Nicholas returns to the street, glancing back.  He looks the gun.  He opens the glove compartment, throws the gun He takes out his CELLULAR PHONE, dialing...
(from cellular)
Mister Van Orton's office...
(into cellular)
Maria.  Have Sutherland meet me at  the Ritz-Carlton.  I'm on my way  there now.
May I tell him... ? But, Nicholas is already pushing DISCONNECT.
Nicholas enters with briefcase.  Sutherland rises to foll
What's happened...
Follow me.
A HOTEL EMPLOYEE rolls a room service cart out.  Nicholas pushes past with Sutherland in tow.  Alan Baer, his hands WIFE and lovely DAUGHTER are seated at a table where a WA lays out a splendid meal.
Nicholas... this is unexpected. Nicholas takes out the SEX PHOTOS, throws them on the tab
Do you actually believe that because  you publish children's books, anyone's  going to care about my reputation? Wife and daughter are frightened.  Alan Baer covers the p with his napkin.

You could print pictures of me wearing  nipple rings and butt-fucking Captain  Kangaroo... all anyone would wonder  was whether the stock was up, or  down. Sutherland's nervousness grows by the second.
Daddy... ?
It's alright, dear.  Mr. Van Orton...
Nicholas...
(still to Alan Baer)
That you've involved Conrad... is  unforgivable.  I am now your enemy.
Are you finished?
No.  This is my lawyer, Samuel  Sutherland.  I thought you two should  meet.

We met, this morning.  I signed the  termination contract for Baer/Grace.   I accepted your settlement, Nicholas.   you were right.  I'm going sailing. Nicholas opens his mouth, but no words come.  He looks to Sutherland.  Sutherland nods to confirm.
You're welcome to join our luncheon.   Maybe we can straighten this out. (motioning to...)
My wife, Mary Carol, and my daughter- in-law, Kaliegh. Wife and daughter give mumbled greetings, having no desir to meet Nicholas.  Nicholas just stands stymied.
It seems I've...  please, disregard  my apparently misguided remarks. Nicholas heads for the door, hurrying out.  Alan, wife,  daughter, the waiter and Sutherland exchange looks.
Well... Sutherland walks to retrieve the sex photos.
Enjoy your lunch. Sutherland smiles, exiting.
Nicholas sits at his desk, opens his briefcase, checking contents.  Soon, Sutherland arrives, shutting the door. watches Nicholas, deciding.
How concerned should I be?
It was a misunderstanding.
Sutherland puts the SEX PHOTOS on the desk.
Someone's playing hardball.  It's  complicated.  Can I ask a favor?
You know you can.
Find out about a company called C.R.S.   Consumer Recreation Services.
Sounds like they make tennis rackets.   What do we know?
Just what I told you.
Nothing else? Nicholas remembers.  He opens up a file drawer in his des

They gave me their waiver.  On  their... wait... Nicholas hands over a file, returning to his briefcase. finds an ENVELOPE with a SMILELY-FACE on it.  He opens it He takes out a silver-plated METAL CRANK.  Like a handle.

What is this? Nicholas looks up.  Sutherland's looking in the file,  quizzically, hands it back... Nicholas studies PINK-TINTED PAGES; the pages Feingold ga him, once dense with words, now completely blank except f NICHOLAS' SIGNATURE and INITIALS several places.
(of the pages)
Christ... I can't believe it...   invisible ink?
You're joking.
It's what they do.  It's like...   being toyed with by a bunch of... (picks up SEX PHOTOS)
Depraved children. Nicholas examines each photo.  Sutherland goes to leave.
Very well.  If you tell me not to  worry, I shan't.
Sam... (as Sutherland stops)
Thank you. Sutherland exits.  Nicholas keeps examining the pictures. He sits forward, finding something... IN A PHOTO: the out-of-focus back of a NAKED WOMAN wearin only a RED BRA.
(INTO PHONE-INTERCOM)
Maria.  The other night... last night,  there was a woman here named  Christine.  I called a taxi, from  that company we use...
(FROM PHONE-INTERCOM)
Elite?
What?
Elite Taxi Company?
Look into it.  Find out which car  answered and where they took her. Nicholas sits back.  He picks up the METAL CRANK, twists in his hands, frowning, pockets it.
The rapid SOUND of a PHONE OFF THE HOOK is HEARD OVER: BE BEEP BEEP BEEP... The Bentley pulls in.  Headlights out.
IN THE CAR, Nicholas takes the gun from the glove compart and puts it in his briefcase.
Dark.  The PHONE OFF THE HOOK is LOUDER, grating: BEEP BE BEEP BEEP BEEP...  Nicholas comes in the back door, peeri into the weak moonlight.

Ilsa? Nicholas replaces the phone on its cradle.  QUIET. He reaches for a light switch, ZAP! -- BLUE SPARKS leap t his fingers.  Nicholas YELPS and shakes his hand out. The switch has been RIPPED OUT, leaving exposed wiring. Nicholas goes to his briefcase, getting the gun and movin forward, wary, calling out...
Ilsa!?
In the blackness, Nicholas comes to stand at the doorway, levels the gun at someone across the room...

I've got a gun! There's a roaring fire in the giant fireplace and a FIGUR in a chair.  Nicholas eases forward... It's the HARLEQUIN in the chair, with a GLOSSY B+W PHOTO  between its teeth.  Nicholas pulls out the picture... A POLICE PHOTO of NICHOLAS' FATHER, his body sprawled. It's stamped "PROPERTY SFPD" in red. There's a NOTE paper-clipped behind: "Like my father before me, I choose eternal sleep."  At t bottom, a RED SIGNATURE ARROW affixed, "Please Sign Here. Suddenly, ALL LIGHTS SURGE TO LIFE, icy and ghoulish -- e and every bulb replaced by BLACK LIGHT... Nicholas pivots slowly, taking in the horror... The wrecked den is covered in FLUORESCENT SPRAY-PAINT

BOY?"  Everywhere.  Across windows, paintings and curtain The ceiling is covered in "MOMMA'S BOY" and OBSCENITIES. Scaffolding's been left behind.  Used SPRAY CANS on the  splattered Oriental rug.  A PAINT/AIR COMPRESSOR.
... fuckers...

A glowing ANARCHY SYMBOL sprayed across the door which is throw open by Nicholas as he enters. It's all BLACK LIT here too.  GRAFFITIED and DESTROYED. "HELTER SKELTER: in jolting letters.  Nicholas backs out.
FOLLOW: Nicholas down the hall and around corners, BLACK  LIGHTS above, walls covered in CURSES and MULTI-COLORED  SQUIGGLES.  Like a bad trip thru the Bat-Cave...
Past OTHER ROOMS likewise awash in vibrant slurs...
Now also revealed as ruined.  Nicholas goes out the door.
Nicholas runs to the GUEST HOUSE.
BANGING on the FRONT DOOR.  Ilsa comes to look thru the  peephole, opens the door to a breathless Nicholas.
Mr. Van Orton... ?
Ilsa... you're alright?
Yes. What do you mean?  What's wrong?
Did the alarm go off?  The house...   they... you didn't see... ?
I don't know what you're talking  about.  What's happened?
There's been a break in.  Lock this  door and stay here.  Don't move a  muscle. Nicholas runs back toward the house.
Be careful!
Crossing the lawn, Nicholas pulls out his cellular phone, dialing as he runs, takes out his gun.
(from cellular)
Nine-one-one, emergency...
(into cellular)
I need the police.  There's been a  break-in at my home...
(from cellular)
Okay, sir.  Stay on the line and  give me your address...
Nicholas enters, still on the phone, locking the door,  beginning to punch the security code into the ALARM KEYPA
(into cellular)
Twenty-two Moore Street.  At the  corner of Moore and Buchanan.
Now, sir, you said it was a break- in...
Yes...
Are you sure they're gone... ? As Nicholas finishes the security code, the KEYPAD BEEPS, and Nicholas straightens, worried.
... are you sure there's not still  someone somewhere in the house?
I... don't think so. And with the DYING HUMMMMMMMM of POWER FAILING, all the B LIGHTS GO OUT.  Nicholas raises his gun...
Oh God... Pointing it into the dark kitchen, hand trembling.

Hello?  Are you still there? Behind, a DARK FIGURE outside rises against the kitchen d window, POUNDING FRANTICALLY!  Nicholas leaps and spins,  CRYING OUT in terror, dropping the gun... The gun bounces across the linoleum. It's CONRAD at the kitchen door, haggard and scared, his  pale face pressed against the glass, pointing frantically
Meet me out front! Conrad ducks away, moving on.
The Bentley takes a corner fast, heading downhill, moving from residential to mostly urban...
Nicholas drives.  Conrad looks back over his shoulder, a on the run, dark circles under his eyes.
Tell me where we're going.
Just drive, man. (slumps low)
It's fucking nuts!
What's this all about, Connie?
Shhhhhhh.  Wait... wait... Conrad flips the sunshade, looks behind it, feels the fab of the roof and the seam of the door. He grips the interior LIGHT, breaks it open, pulling the  bulb and wires.
What are you doing?
They're methodical.  They're nothing  if they're not that.
Who?
C.R.S.  Who do you think?  Jesus H.,  thank your lucky charms.  To think  what I almost got you into.
(miserable)
Yeah, almost...
You dodged a bullet.
How do you mean, exactly?
They fuck you and they fuck you and  they fuck you.  And then, just when  you think it's done, that's when the  real fucking begins.
Slow down, take a breath...
It doesn't stop, Nick.
I paid the bill, I gave 'em their  money, but it all started again.   They won't leave me alone...
What have they been doing to you?
Everything.  I'm a goddamn human- pinata...
Calm down.  Why would they keep  playing after you paid?
You think I know?  I paid them more  to make it stop. BOOM! -- the wheel jerks in Nicholas' hand, TIRES SCREAM.
What the hell... !?
A TIRE'S BLOWN OUT.  Riding the rim, the car jerks over..
Nicholas stops at the curb.  Conrad's turned in his seat.
It's them.  They did this.
It's a flat tire.  That's all.
How do you know?
We're going to figure this out.  Get  a grip on yourself.
Okay... okay. Conrad faces forward.  Nicholas gets out to look at the w using his cellular, then returns to the open window.
The phone's dead.
Really?
Do you know how to change a tire?
No.  Do you? (off Nicholas' frown)
Can't be too hard, can it?  I don't  think we should be here out in the  open like this. Nicholas rubs his temples, looks all around, frustrated.

Check the glove box... might be  another battery there. Conrad OPENS the glove compartment: KEYS SPILL OUT.  At l fifty, silver and gold, all stamped "C.R.S." Conrad's breath catches in his throat.  He looks to Nicho afraid.  Nicholas leans closer...
How did those... ?
You're part of it...
What?  Connie... Conrad climbs out, pointing across the roof of the car...
No!  You're one of them.  Of course,  it makes perfect sense!
No, it doesn't!  Those keys were put  there.  I didn't even know...
You're behind this, aren't you?  You  and your sick friends.  Well, make  it stop!
Listen to yourself.   Why would I do  anything like what you're describing?
Because you hate me.  Because you  had to be here, when mom died.   Because you had to do it alone. (near tears)
Well, don't you think if I'd known... I'd've been here too.  I'd have been  here...
Stop this.  It's not true...
I'm sorry, Christ, I'm sorry!  How  many more times do I have to say I'm  sorry before you forgive me... ?

Stop it! Conrad bolts away, full tilt, into a nearby PARK and PUBL GARDENS.  Nicholas gives chase, calling after. AHEAD, Conrad runs headlong, disappearing thru thick bush Nicholas follows, downhill, falls and slides, gets up.  A the bottom, he shoves thru vegetation... On the other side, Nicholas looks all directions, gulping air.  Conrad's nowhere to be seen.  Nicholas stops.
(shouting)

Connie! Far off, there's a concrete path winding thru the park pa a BANK OF PAYPHONES.  ONE PAYPHONE starts RINGING.  Nicho starts back the way he came. Behind, ALL THE PAYPHONES start RINGING.  Nicholas halts. He runs to the phones, answers one.
(into phone)
You sons-of-bitches...
(from phone)
Flippy?  Is Flippy there?  Flippy? Nichols slams the phone down, picks up another...
(from phone)

If you'd like to make a call, please  hang up and... PHONE STOP RINGING.  Nicholas hangs up, digging out his  wallet.  Rifling thru it, he comes up with the VALET TICK with the C.R.S. EMERGRENCY 800-NUMBER on it.  He dials... Puts the phone to his ear.  BUSY SIGNAL.  He slaps the he tongue, redialing, waiting...
(from phone)
We're sorry.  The number you have  dialed has been disconnected or is  no longer in service... He throws the receiver, tears the valet ticket in half an tosses it, then steps back -- KICKS the phone.

Nicholas returns to his car, looks down at the flat tire. At the rear, Nicholas opens the trunk.  He reaches in and takes out the car's JACK.  He looks at it like an alien t turns it over, tosses it into the street. He closes the trunk, REMOTE's the ALARM, walking away. There's a TAXI heading this way.  Nicholas hails it...
Nicholas gets in.  GLASS separates him from the CAB DRIVE
Twenty-two Moore Street. The driver nods and hits the gas.
The taxi roars down the street.
Nicholas has his head back, eyes closed, loosening his ti He looks out the window, narrow his eyes.
(pointing)
Um... you want to turn here... (TAXI KEEPS GOING)
Excuse me, you missed the turn. The driver says nothing.  Nicholas knocks on the glass.
Did you hear me?  You're... Nicholas stops, noticing the DRIVER I.D. on the other sid of the partition.  "California Regal Sedans."  C.R.S.
No... no, no, no.  Stop the car! The taxi HALTS at a LIGHT.  Nicholas tries the DOOR HANDL Doesn't work.  He tries the WINDOW HANDLE -- it COMES OFF
The cab PEELS OUT as the light turns green.
Nicholas tries the other door, panicky.  Same results -- locked in.  The taxi makes a SCREEEEECHING TURN...
The taxi speeds up... heading for a WHARF AREA and PIERS.
Nicholas presses against the partition, urgent, calm...

Listen.  I am a very wealthy man.   Whatever they're paying you, I'll  double it! The taxi driver simply opens his door and leaps out... THRU THE WINDOW: the driver ROLLS, a perfectly executed s fall.  Nicholas can't believe.  He grabs frantically for seatbelt, SNAPS it around him, looks up... Opens his mouth to SCREAM...
The taxi goes FLYING off a deserted pier... airborne... SPLASHES DOWN! in the San Francisco Bay.
Nicholas is jerked forward, breath slammed out of him.

head_text.subj: ON THE SURFACE OF THE WATER

text: The taxi goes under in an eruption of bubbles.
THRU THE TAXI WINDOW: Nicholas pulls off his seatbelt,  extricates himself and starts kicking the window.  Dashbo lights grow eerie as they submerge.
Nicholas stops kicking, trying to calm.  He looks to the  front: water's gushing in through two-inches of open wind The taxi's less that half full.
(to himself)
It's a game... it's a game... He tries the DOOR HANDLE again, yanking, to no avail.  He realizes something, searches his pockets...
The taxi sinks, headlights dimming in murkier depths.
Nicholas finds the METAL CRANK.  He takes a deep breath.. SUBMERGING.  He puts the crank in the WINDOW HANDLE HOLE, turns the crank.  The WINDOW LOWERS, water flooding in...
Nicholas swims out the window, heading upwards...
Nicholas bursts to the surface, sucking air.  He treads w catching his breath.
